wikipedia_page.main: Patricia Gibson (born 12 May 1968) is a Scottish National Party (SNP) politician serving as the SNP Shadow Secretary of State for Housing, Communities and Local Government since 2021. She has been the Member of Parliament (MP) for North Ayrshire and Arran since winning the seat at the 2015 general election.

North Ayrshire and Arran (UK Parliament constituency)
response: Once a longtime Conservative seat, the area had been represented by Labour MPs from 1987 until 2015. Patricia Gibson, has held the seat as a SNP member since 2015.

The Scottish National Party narrowly won the seat of Cunninghame North during the 2007 Scottish parliamentary election and wished to capitalise on this success during the general election. They chose 41-year-old retired English teacher Cllr Patricia Gibson to contest the seat.

Gibson was identified as one of 12 Holyrood politicians employing a close family member in 2013, but declined to provide information on the salary, work hours, or whether the job had been advertised. His wife Patricia Gibson (now an MP) was employed as a policy adviser. Employing family members was declared bad practice in 2010 and outlawed in 2015.
